definition: rare commodity worth hoarding/object for profiteering
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude

sentences.english: GG: Come and see. Some became millionaires for hoarding garlic as a rare commodity.
sentences.chinese: 过来看，大蒜奇货可居，有人以此暴富。

sentences.english: Her skills were in such demand that she could dictate her own salary.
sentences.chinese: 她因其技术奇货可居，故可以主宰自己的薪金待遇。

definition: to sell only for a good price (idiom)/to wait for a good offer
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
lit. the emperor's daughter does not worry about whether she will be able to marry (idiom)/fig. highly sought after
pinyin: huang2 di4 nu:3 er2 bu4 chou2 jia4

definition: to artificially inflate/to bid up (the price)
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
lit. treasuring a jade ring becomes a crime (idiom); to get into trouble on account of a cherished item/fig. A person's talent will arouse the envy of others.
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
